title: Half Shot at Sunrise (1930 Comedy Musical) directed by Paul Sloane

sources.title: Half Shot at Sunrise (1930 Comedy Musical) directed by Paul Sloane
sources.description:
World's greatest comedians are in the Army now! Clowns in khaki run wild on the Boulevards... bounce laughs off the Eiffel Tower... play riot in the Grin and Garter belt at Gay Paree!
The stage stars Wheeler and Woolsey play two soldiers who go absent without leave in Paris, during World War I.

Original title: Half Shot at Sunrise (1930)
This film is available with subtitles in many language options.


Colorized version: https://youtu.be/gJ3ZA5rWXMY

Director: Paul Sloane
Writers: James Ashmore Creelman, Anne Caldwell, Ralph Spence
Genres: Classic film. Comedy, Musical
Budget: $529,000
Main Cast: 
Bert Wheeler
Robert Woolsey
Dorothy Lee
George MacFarlane
Edna May Oliver
Leni Stengel
Roberta Robinson


00:00 Full movie (with subtitles).
01:23 Military chaos ensues as two men go AWOL in Paris, causing diplomatic tensions and jeopardizing crucial war plans.
09:34 Banter and humor ensue as guests at a social event discuss fashion and gender roles.
17:19 Mischievous antics ensue as characters navigate social interactions and military encounters.
28:23: Scheming to catch impostors, a Colonel's daughter teams up with a sergeant in a humorous pursuit.
37:04 Two individuals encounter a woman who plans to profit from their presence in Paris.
46:07 Unusual dining requests lead to comical exchanges between a customer and waiter.
55:11 Flirtatious banter between Jim and Eileen as Jim prepares to deliver important papers to General Hale.
1:02:20 A comedic conversation unfolds between two characters discussing their origins and potential heroic actions.
1:10:17 Mission to deliver important papers to General Hail amidst danger and sacrifice.
